meanings.definition: To cause someone to be no longer close or affectionate with someone else.
meanings.sent1: She estranged her friend by spreading rumors.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, they became estranged.
meanings.sent3: The cat estranged itself from the new puppy.
meanings.sent4: Misunderstandings can estrange even the closest of friends.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal was so deep that it estranged them forever.

meanings.definition: To be no longer close or affectionate with someone else.
meanings.sent2: The siblings slowly became estranged over time.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear felt estranged from the other toys.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words spoken in anger estranged them permanently.
meanings.sent5: The long-distance relationship started to feel estranged.

meanings.definition: To alienate or remove oneself from a situation or relationship.
meanings.sent1: He decided to estrange himself from the toxic environment.
meanings.sent2: Feeling overwhelmed, she chose to estrange herself from social media.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to estrange himself from the group project.
meanings.sent4: The decision to estrange from the company was difficult but necessary.
meanings.sent5: In order to find peace, she had to estrange from the drama.
